Cameroonian soldiers killed 3 members of a Central African armed group reported to be composed of anti-Balaka fighters after they attacked the border town of Garoua Boulai.

properties.NOTES: The Cameroonian government said that its army killed 107 Boko Haram fighters and lost 8 of its own soldiers during fighting between Oct.15-16 in Amchide and Limani. 30 civilians were also killed by Boko Haram fighters before the army arrived.

An unidentified armed group from the Central African Republic ambushed two trucks near the village of Yokosire between Oct.24-25, kidnapping 7 Cameroonians. While on their way back to CAR, they also kidnapped a shepherd.

Cameroonian defense forces clashed with an unidentified armed group from the Central African Republic and freed four hostages taken earlier that day.

properties.NOTES: 1 Cameroonian soldier was killed and another injured when their car hit a mine between Fotokol and Kousseri. The mine was reported to have been laid by Boko Haram fighters.
Clashes occurred between unnamed "insurgents" and Cameroonian troops, during which 5 civilians were killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Suspected members of Islamist extremist group Boko Haram attacked a border town in Cameroon on Saturday, leading to six hours of fighting that killed a soldier and several insurgents, authorities said.

properties.NOTES: The Cameroonian army has reportedly killed around 100 Boko Haram militants and destroyed their training camp in the far north.

properties.ACTOR1: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic
properties.NOTES: Agreement: The Government of Cameroon freed a rebel leader from CAR and secured the release of the 15 Cameroonians kidnapped by FDPC in September, along with a Polish priest and 10 civilians hostages from CAR.
A confrontation between the Bamukumbit and Baligangsen villages of the Balikumbut sub-division led to 1 fatality and the destruction of four houses in Baligangsen.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: The Cameroonian military announced that it has been carrying out major operations in the north near Lake Chad and Ngouma since Dec.6, which have led to 7 Boko Haram fighters killed and 25 detained, as well as the seizure of military equipment.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: The Cameroonian military has announced that 180 Boko Haram fighters were killed when 400 fighters attacked Amchide. No casualties were reported on the Cameroonian side.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram has reportedly started making more use of landmines, and 8 Cameroonian soldiers have been reported killed by explosive devices of this kind over the last 10 days.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: The Cameroonian military has reported that 116 Boko Haram fighters were killed during an hour of fighting around Amchide. A Cameroonian soldier was also killed, and another is missing. They said this was a particularly intense attack involving almost 100

properties.ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: The Cameroonian military says it has dismantled a Boko Haram training camp in the Far North region. 84 children being trained there were freed. About 100 people suspected of having links to Boko Haram were also arrested over the weekend.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: At least 23 civilians were killed and Mbaljuel village in the Mozogo area burned down allegedly by Boko Haram militants.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram attacked the village of Achigchia, forcing the Cameroonian military to retreat. They also took the nearby military base.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: The Cameroonian military, including elements of the Rapid Intervention Battalion, took back the military base near Ashigashiya with the help of air strikes. 8 soldiers have been reported missing since they took back the camp.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: A vehicle of the BIR hit an improvised explosive device, killing 2 soldiers and injuring 2 others.
At least 15 people, including 12 security personnel, were wounded in a clash with residents of Bamali while police attempted to receover firearms allegedly stolen from Bamali palace.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram fighters attacked a bus on the Waza-Mora road, killing 11 passengers and injuring 6 others. The fighters then took the remaining passengers hostage and transported them away using the bus.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram fighters attacked a Cameroonian military base in Kolofata, killing 1 soldier. The Cameroonian military claims it killed 143 Boko Haram fighters and repulsed the attack at the military base and other strategic areas around the locality over 5 h

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters while travelling in a pick-up truck.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram attacked the Mayo Tsanaga district - including the villages of Maki, Maba and Mmokolo. They kidnapped up to 80 people in their largest kidnapping yet in Cameroon, burning houses and killing three.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Troops fought in "heavy clashes" with Boko Haram, leaving two Cameroonian soldiers injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Explosives buried by Boko Haram on the Fotokol - Kousseri road have recently killed an unspecified number of civilians. Truckers and other civilians have almost entirely ceased using the road.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram attacked the Gnam-Gnam area, killing three villagers and burning houses.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram attacked the Dola village to steal a horse, and villagers fought back with bows and arrows. Three locals and three militants were killed in the exchange.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram militants killed two elderly and two youth in Ashigashiya.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram fired rockets from Gambaru to Fotokol.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram attacked a Chadian army contingent near Fotokol. 3 soldiers were killed and 12 wounded, mostly by explosive devices, and 123 militants were killed according to the military.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 13 - 16 Chadian soldiers and 6 - 7 Cameroonian troops were killed in a counter-attack by Boko Haram in the northern town of Fotokol before they were able to repel the militants. At least 300 militants were killed in the fighting (Xinhua).

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Around 800 Boko Haram militants attacked the town of Fotokol, killing 81 civilians and setting fire to buildings before being repelled by regional forces. Up to 500 civilians were wounded

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram hijacked a bus near Koza, taking eight Cameroonian girls hostage and killing seven, whose bodies they scattered near the border with Nigeria.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Nine Cameroonian soldiers were injured in an attack by Boko Haram.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram hijacked a bus of 20 passengers in the north between Koza and Mora, killing 12 and incrementally releasing the other 8.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Extremists from Boko Haram attacked the town of Kolofata, looting food and livestock.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram hijacked a bus of 30 passengers in Tourou.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: In ongoing clashes, Boko Haram attacked the positions of the Chadian military and Chad continued to reinforce its positions in Fotokol. 13 militants and one Chadian soldier were killed, several were wounded.
Police officers who were patrolling the coast by boat exchanged fire with seven Nigerian gunmen that led to the death of two policemen and the disappearance of a third.

A human rights group claims Cameroons security forces have been using torture and illegal detention in the fight against Boko Haram in the far north. 50 people reportedly suffocated while locked in a cell and were buried in mass graves.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 5 soldiers and 86 militants were killed in a series of clashes in the Waza region.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Seven or eight villagers were killed when they fought back against Boko Haram fighters who stole 70 cows and torched houses in Gaboua. Nine of the militants were also killed by the villagers who were armed with clubs, machetes and bows and arrows.

properties.ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 2 Cameroonian soldiers and 12 civilians died as a result of IEDs on the Mora-Limani road set by Boko Haram.
Movement of forces: 2,500 Chadian troops who were fighting Boko Haram in Nigeria crossed back over to the Cameroonian towns of Fotokol and Maltam.
Around 8,000 people marched against Boko Haram and to show solidarity with the security forces.

16 people were kidnapped when a bus was seized near the CAR border at Babio by a heavily armed group believed to be made up of ex-Seleka rebels. Those kidnapped include four traditional leaders and the head of the Organization of Women of the Cameroon Pe

15 heavily armed men likely from a CAR rebel group tried to carry out a kidnapping of 8 civilians but locals attacked with guns and machetes, releasing the hostages, killing several militants (coded as 3) and taking two captive. Some were wounded but fin

20 March-5 April. A video emerged in July 2018 showing soldiers executing two women and two children. Analysis has determined that the incident likely occurred between 20 March - 5 April 2015 near a military barrack by Zelevet. Seven soldiers were later
Boko Haram attacked Dabanga village and killed three civilians.
Boko Haram fighters attacked a Cameroonian military position and burned down houses in Amchide but were repulsed without reported casualties.

Boko Haram militants, the deadly Islamist sect, has attacked two villages - Bia and Blaberi - overnight in northern Cameroon. Most recent death toll indicates 19 people killed in the violence; many of the victims decapitated.

Boko Haram militants, the deadly Islamist sect, has killed no fewer than 10 people in overnight attacks on two villages in northern Cameroon. There were consecutive attacks by Boko Haram in Bia and Blaberi in the district of Kolofata in the early morning
An unidentified armed group attacked a market in the district of Betare Oya, taking hostages. Following a clash with the local population, the hostages were released.
A Cameroonian soldier was killed and two others injured while on patrol in the far north when they were ambushed by Boko Haram militants.
Boko Haram clashed with the Cameroonian military on a patrol near Zevelet, killing two soldiers, and injuring three soldiers and a civilian. The military returned fire, killing around 60 militants.
Movement of forces: Cameroon sent military reinforcements to the border with Nigeria, near Maroua, in anticipation of further fighting with Boko Haram.
"Two INGO national staff members were shot after being ambushed by armed assailants while travelling from the project site back to their base of operations."
Two Cameroonian soldiers were killed and around 20 injured when Boko Haram attacked using grenades in the far north.
Boko Haram attacked Dabanga and Ngassa, stealing supplies and taking hostages. Two security personnel died and many were injured in pursuit of the militants.
Boko Haram attacked Dabanga and Ngassa, stealing supplies and taking hostages. Two security personnel died and many were injured in pursuit of the militants.
100 students at the University of Maroua protested in tribute to a fellow student who was recently killed in a fight with a uniformed military man.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 7 July 2015, Boko Haram clashed with a militia group in the Mayo-Sava department, leaving three militia members dead.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Bodo in the extreme north but were repelled by military forces, who killed 3-24 militants.

Twin suicide blasts killed at least 13 and injured 17 others, many of them soldiers, at a bar in the border town of Fotokol. The bombers were dressed in burqas and struck as locals were breaking their Ramadan fast. Of the 13 killed (all reportedly during

Twin suicide blasts killed at least 13 and injured 17 others, many of them soldiers, at a bar in the border town of Fotokol. The bombers were dressed in burqas and struck as locals were breaking their Ramadan fast. Of the 13 killed (all reportedly during
Residents of Lobo district in Lekie set up a protest camp on the Yaounde-Douala highway to demand compensation related to the construction of the highway for their village which has not appeared.
At least 20 people were killed, including the perpetrators, after 2 allegedly female suicide bombers blew themselves up in a busy marketplace in Maroua. At least 32 people were wounded.
A suicide bomber attacked a popular night spot in the Pont Vert neighbourhood of Maroua, killing at least 21 civilians and injuring 67.
Boko Haram behead 3 people in Tchebe-Tchebe, and set fire to land.

Boko Haram set fire to police and military facilities in Afade, killing one. Reports differ on whether the person killed was a gendarme or an inmate. 3 other inmates died in the fires. 4 soldiers and 3 policeman reportedly missing.

Boko Haram attacked the villages of Tchakarmari and Kangaleri (geo coordinates not available) in the North. They burned houses, killed at least 8 (fatalities spread over two locations), and kidnapped up to 145 civilians.
Security Measures: Police sealed off the weekly market in Maroua to conduct a security raid and identity checks.
Hundreds of Boko Haram fighters attacked Ashigashiya and Cameroonian troops responded, leaving 10 militants and 1 soldier dead and 2 soldiers injured. Some arrests were also made.

Arrests: Refugees from CAR have reportedly been involved in frequent theft and hostage taking, prompting the Cameroonian police to initiative a wave of arrests of all CAR refugees found outside of predetermined humanitarian camps.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Blame, torching homes and killing 8 civilians and 2 soldiers.
Arrests: Authorities arrested journalist Simon Ateba who was investigating the conditions of Nigerian refugees in the far north. He was deatined for four days before being released.

At least 30 people were killed in the far north in successive suicide attacks in Keraoua - one in the marketplace and the second near a military camp. The suicide bombers were women; no group has claimed responsibility though preliminary blame is pointed

At least 30 people were killed in the far north in successive suicide attacks in Keraoua - one in the marketplace and the second near a military camp. The suicide bombers were women; no group has claimed responsibility though preliminary blame is pointed
At least 9 were killed and 14 injured in twin suicide attacks by two teenage boys likely linked to Boko Haram. The attacks took place in the Latin Quarter and the main market of Kolofata.
The army pushed back an attack by Boko Haram, killing at least three.
About 9 civilians were killed by suspected Boko Haram assailants who also burned several houses.
Boko Haram ambushed soldiers on patrol in Dabanga, killing two and burning two vehicles.

Two Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate 200 meters from each other in the market in Mora. Civilians were targeted. 5 killed, including an off-duty policeman, two civilians, and the two suicide bombers. 29 wounded.
Clashes between military and Boko Haram in Amchide. 2 Boko Haram killed on Sept 21.
Clashes between military and Boko Haram in Amchide for second day. 15 Boko Haram killed on Sept 22.
2 women suicide bombers of Boko Haram killed themselves and injured two farmers.
Boko Haram killed 8 and kidnapped a young girl in an attack on a village in the Tika area. Over 100 houses were burned along with at least one vehicle, and several were injured.
Over 10 Boko Haram attacked the village of Siguel, near Bodo, setting it on fire. No report of casualties.
In retaliation for arrests in Bodo, Boko Haram attacked the nearby village of Mafoufou, burning most of the homes.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 30 September 2015, after Boko Haram attacked the village of Siguel, they headed towards Bodo where a local militia fought back and captured 5 militants.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen launched rockets at two commercial trucks near Dabanga, injuring at least one.
Twin suicide bombings by young women likely affiliated with Boko Haram killed at least 9 and wounded dozens in the town of Kangeleri, near Mora.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
properties.NOTES: Movement of forces: About 90 US troops were deployed to Cameroon to help stop the spread of Boko Haram. A total of 300 troops will eventually be deployed, meant to be armed for protection but not for combat.

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram ambushed a military vehicle, killing an officer from the Rapid Intervention Force and injuring three other soldiers.

Boko Haram raided Cameroonian territory near the village of Soueram in the Far Nort. Military response led to "heavy fighting". Coordinates are approximate based on Soueram's location 17 km from Fotokol.

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: Boko Haram ambushed military forces from the Rapid Intervention Battalion. Casualties unknown.
Boko Haram attacked Ashigashiya. Military response led to violent clashes.
Military responded to a Boko Haram raid on the town of Doulo, engaging in a gun battle with the militants. Casualties unknown.
Boko Haram raided the village of Doulo, killing 8 and injuring 9.
About 20 Boko Haram militants on motorcycles attacked Keraoua, killing at least 9 and kidnapping 20.
The military retook control of Keraoua after Boko Haram took control earlier in the morning. Reports indicated that Boko Haram fled as additional troops arrived, and there was no continued fighting.
One day after attacking Keraoua and killing several civilians, Boko Haram "seized control of the town" as military forces were sent in for reinforcement.
A woman was beheaded by unidentified assailants on disputed farm land near Buea Road.
Boko Haram conducted an incursion into the village of Gafe, abducting 6 civilians before the military could be alerted.
Boko Haram attacked the village of Barakesse, killing two civilians and burning around 40 homes.

Security Measures: On 3 November 2015, the government began providing security equipment, including light firearms and knives, to local vigilante groups in the extreme north as part of national efforts against Boko Haram.
At least 3 civilians and 1 young female suicide bomber were killed in an attack attributed to Boko Haram. Authorities responded, shooting and killing a second bomber.
Boko Haram assassinated the son of a tribal chief.
Boko Haram killed five people in an incursion into Bia.
The regional president of the Cameroon Peoples Democratic Movement was assassinated by Boko Haram. Authorities responded by killing around 10 assailants in the extreme north.
Boko Haram attacked two large trucks, burning one and taking the other with the driver and his assistant on board.
Property destruction: 10 Boko Haram attacked the home of a local leader with grenades and burned down a school.
5 Boko Haram killed in fire fight with Cameroonian army
Army launched ground and air assault against Boko Haram, capturing 19.
Four teenage girls associated with Boko Haram blew themselves up, killing a traditional chief and four of his family members.

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: Military forces carried out "mopping up exercises" against Boko Haram over three days in the Mayo-Sava area of extreme north region, killing around 100 militants and releasing hundreds of their hostages.
Boko Haram killed one and wounded two, burning buildings in a village near Fotokol.

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: Military forces carried out "mopping up exercises" against Boko Haram over three days in the Mayo-Sava area of extreme north region, killing around 100 militants and releasing hundreds of their hostages.
Two Boko Haram suicide bombers killed themselves and 5 civilians, injuring at least one soldier near the Dabanga military base.

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion

an attack by Boko Haram against the village of Ouro-Mari in the Makary Subdivision is foiled by a military response.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 2 April, BH elements attacked a military post in Sagme, Fotokol. 5 soldiers and 15 BH men dead; 3 soldiers wounded. The attacked soldiers were those who participated in the Gomaram operation.

On 2 April, suspected ADF separatists and government troops clashed in the bush of Nguti. The government claims that soldiers freed 12 tourists "kidnapped" by separatists, whereas the tour operator denied this circumstance.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 2 April, the Cameroonian army post in Amtalia, Waza, was attacked by BH men and kamikazes. 2 kamikazes dead and 1 soldier wounded.

properties.NOTES: Looting: On 1 April, BH men seized 254 cattle heads and 193 sheep in Matakaya, Amchide.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 2 April, a man was killed by BH men following an attack in Mogbere, Limani.

On 4 April, suspected ADF separatists and government troops clashed in Belo, Northwest region. At least one separatist dead.
Property destruction: Around 4 April, suspected separatists destroyed a number of houses and property in the Mbonge subdivision, including in Bakumba, Masaka, Ngwandi villages.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 8 April, Boko Haram men attacked the village of Alagarno (Kolofata) killing 2 people and injuring 2 others.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

During the 12 April week, Ambazonian gunmen are suspected to have kidnapped the President of a credit union in Ndian division bringing him to an unknown destination.
On 13 April, the Kumba village was attacked by Ambazonian separatists. Army repulsed them.
On 17 April, separatists and military clashed in Ajin, North-West region: the village was burned down and several dead were reported.

Around 17 April, villages near Ajin in Nord-Ouest including Anyajua village (which is located in the Belo district), were set on fire either by Cameroonian soldiers or separatists following their clashes. Toll unknown.

On 20 April, a Cameroonian military vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Ambazonian separatists in Eyumedjock nearby Menji, while going to support their fellow-soldiers engaged in a battle nearby. 2 dead and 4 severely wounded.

Around 20 April, the governor of the North-West region was attacked while going to the inauguration ceremony of an administrative officer in the Momo department. Cameroonian security forces repelled the attack. Toll unknown.
20 April. An armed group attacked a police station in Widikum. Two people were injured during the clashes.
21 April. During the weekend, an armed group attacked a naval base in Manja. 'Several' fatalities were reported .

On 28 July, suspected armed separatists attacked the Ndop prison, Ngohketunjia Division, with gunfire and arson, freeing hundreds of inmates and stealing ammunitions.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

On 31 July, 3 Cameroonian gendarmes were ambushed and severely wounded as Ambazonian separatists attacked them on the Wum-Bamenda axis.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 31 July, a Boko Haram man was killed during clashes with the Cameroonian army in Amchide.

On 1 August, a gendarme shot and killed a civilian after he refused to stop at a checkpoint near Mbouda between Batcham and Balenssing, Bamboutos. The residents then attacked the police post in Batcham to find the gendarme and avenge their friend.

On 1 August, a gendarme shot and killed a civilian after he refused to stop at a checkpoint near Mbouda between Batcham and Balenssing, Bamboutos. The residents then attacked the police post in Batcham to find the gendarme and avenge their friend.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

properties.NOTES: On 3 August, 3 BH fighters were killed during clashes with Cameroonian soldiers in Ldaoutsaf, Mayo Moskota.
On 4 August, the Divisional Officer of the Menchum valley was kidnapped by armed men on the Bamenda - Wum road. He was freed two days later.
On or around 4 August, clashes between Cameroonian and Separatists forces erupted in Mbengwi, Momo. Toll unavailable.
On or around 4 August Cameroonian forces set fire to the Kake Kumba village, Meme.
On or around 4 August, separatists ambushed a convoy of Cameroonian forces in Bafut, Bamenda. 8 soldiers and a separatist dead.
On or around 4 August, clashes between Cameroonian and separatists forces erupted in Belo, Boyo County. Toll unavailable.
On 5 August, 4 gendarmes were killed in Esu, a village near Wum, North-Ouest, as they were ambushed by possibly separatists. 6 assailants also dead.
On 5 August, Cameroonian and separatists forces clashed in Tombel, Kupe Muanenguba county. No available toll.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 6 August 2018, BH men attacked the Zaman village, 17 km from Makary, killing one vigilante.
Around 6 August, Cameroonian forces reportedly attacked a local government health unit in Mbonge, Meme County. A sick victim was burned to death.
Around 6 August, Cameroonian forces reportedly killed a medical doctor and his wife in Mbengwi, Momo.
Property destruction: Around 6 August, Cameroonian forces reportedly shut down and damaged health centers in the Momo County.
Non-violent activity: Around 6 August, Cameroonian forces reportedly attacked and harassed several times the staff of the Mbingo Baptist hospital, Boyo County.
Around 6 August, Cameroonian forces reportedly opened fire at an ambulance transporting patients between Mbingo Baptist Hospital and the Bamenda General Hospital, leaving a nurse seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 9 August, Boko Haram men killed a man at his residence in Limani, Mayo Sava.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 11 August, BH men attacked Cameroonian soldiers in Gosi, Mokolo, Mayo Tsanaga: 1 assailant killed and several wounded.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 11 August, the chief of the Naga health centre, Darak, was kidnapped by Boko Haram men.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

On 12 August, a traditional chief of the Ekondo Titi commune was assassinated by some armed men in Ekondo Titi, Ndian.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 13 August, Cameroonian soldiers and BH men clashed in Garno, Fotokol, Logone-et-Chari: 8 BH dead, 2 prisoners, 3 wounded.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On 13 August, BH and Cameroonian soldiers clashed in a locality close to Garno, Makary: 2 soldiers and 8 BH men dead, several wounded.
On 14 August, Cameroonian forces reportedly killed at least 5 separatists and freed a hostage during an attack carried out on a separatist camp in Tabli, Lebialem division.

On 14 August, some armed men attacked a convoy transporting the CPDM Member of parliament for Ngoketunjia Njingum Musa, in Babungo, Ngoketunjia Division. At least 7 separatists, 4 soldiers and one civilian were killed, several others injured.
On 14 August, clashes between soldiers and unknown gunmen were recorded in Bamenda, North West region. One dead.
On 14 August, suspected separatists tortured a Cameroonian soldier in Ediki. A video of his killing emerged online, showing him brought to a mass grave.
On 16 August, the first assistant mayor of the Ndop council, Nkoketunjia Division of the North West region was reportedly abducted by unidentified armed men.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

On 22 August, separatits attacked the Cameroonian army in its Furu-Awa, Menchum, camp and seized an important number of weapons. Several soldiers were wounded.
Report of massive arrests and "torture" by soldiers in the Wum area in reprisal for the kidnapping of the President of the Wum High Court on 21 August by suspected separatists. Toll unavailable.
On 24 August, at least two gendarmes were killed by suspected separatists in Zhoa, Wum, during clashes.
24 August. The military reported killing 10 Ambazonian Separatists in Bekora and Lipenja. The fatalities were disaggregated between the villages.
24 August. The military reported killing 10 Ambazonian Separatists in Bekora and Lipenja. The fatalities were disaggregated between the villages.

properties.NOTES: On 24 August, BH men and Cameroonian soldiers clashed in Nguetchewe: no available toll.
28 August. In retaliation for the deaths of two soldiers the week prior, military personnel attacked the village of Zoa, 20km from Wum, burning down houses.
28 August. A retired soldier was killed by separatists who suspected he was providing support to soldiers in Guzang.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 30 August. Boko Haram attacked the town of Fotokol and looted shops in the town. One fatality was reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 30 August. Boko Haram attacked Matakaya. One person was killed.
01 September. During the night, the Director of Bamali school was killed by unidentified armed men.

01 September. Military forces reportedly attacked the town of Pinyin in Santa subdivision (Nord-Ouest) - specifically the Kwindegli, Hausa, Ndanpang, and Ngali neighborhoods. Unconfirmed reports have put the death toll at 5.
01 September. The body of a local radio employee was found. He had reportedly been detained by security forces the day before.
02 September. A police officer was kidnapped in Kumbo. Ambazonian Separatists are believed to be responsible for the abduction.

02 September. Ambazonian separatists and the military reportedly clashed in the village of Mukanga in Muyuka. Clashes also occurred at the center of Muyuka on the same day (coded separately). No fatalities reported.
02 September. The army clashed with Ambazonian separatists in Muyuka. Four separatists were killed and three soldiers were reportedly injured.
03 September. A Principal and seven students were kidnapped by an armed group. The assailants amputated two of the principal's fingers before he was later released, along with two of the students.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 03 September. Boko Haram attacked Fotokol/Djabrali and killed two persons.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 04 September. Two persons were killed when Boko Haram attacked Gouzoudou.

04 September. The military launched an attack against Ambazonian separatists in the town of Yemngeh, 10 km from Zhoa in Menchum Division (North West) (approx. Coordinates used at 10km from Zoa). According to the army, 27 separatists were killed.

04 September. The Military reported operations against Ambazonian Separatists in Ndop, Bamessing, and Bambalang. The Separatists camps were destroyed. A 'dozen' fatalities were reported (coded as 12 then disaggregated between the three locations).

04 September. The Military reported operations against Ambazonian Separatists in Ndop, Bamessing, and Bambalang. The Separatists camps were destroyed. A 'dozen' fatalities were reported (coded as 12 then disaggregated between the three locations).

04 September. Ambazonian Separatists reportedly entered Bamenda in the morning and went to the hotel where the Minister of Education was staying. The group then clashed with military forces in the city. The government reports three fatalities, while othe
04 September. The Fon of the Bafut kingdom was kidnapped by separatists who alleged he was supporting military efforts against the group. He was released by the assailants a few hours later.
Weapons seizure: 05 September. The military announced the seizure of over 800 firearms from armed separatists in Nord-Ouest.
05 September. A civilian car hit a landmine in Zourou. No indication of fatalities.

properties.NOTES: 05 September. Boko Haram ambushed a Rapid Intervention Battalion vehicle with a rocket in Malloumri (Kolofata). Five military personnel were wounded in the attack.
07 September. Hundreds of women protested in Bamenda. The women protested against the continued conflict in the region.
07 September. A father and his three sons were shot by the military. They were reportedly mistaken for secessionists.

08 September. Separatists launched an attack on a road construction site at the entrance to Bamenda. During the attack at least one civilian was killed (some sources indicate two fatalities). The separatists used the equipment to dig a large hole in the

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion

properties.NOTES: 08 September. Boko Haram attempted to loot a shop in Gouzoudou but were repelled by BIR forces.
09 September. Separatists attacked the police station and gendarmerie barracks in Oku. Three police officers were reportedly abducted during the attack. No indication of fatalities.
09 September. Two youths were killed in Ekona, reportedly by the military.

11 September. Military forces reportedly killed 15 separatists and captured two others during a raid on a hideout in Chomba. They also recovered arms and ammunition. Two soldiers reportedly sustained injuries.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

properties.NOTES: 11 September. Local residents reported an attack on Dyounde by Boko Haram. The attackers were repelled by a local militia group. Coordinates were approximated based on 15km from Double and near Ngalbiwa.

12 September. Ambazonian separatists and military forces have reportedly been clashing around Tadu. Locals reported fatalities on both sides (coded as 10). The coordinates for Tadu are approximate, based on its proximity to Kumbo within the Bui district.
13 September. Separatists launched an attack on a military base in Nkwen. The military forces repelled the attackers, killing six of the separatists.

Property destruction: 14 September. Following clashes against Ambazonian separatists in the area, military forces reportedly burned homes in Tadu. Residents have reportedly been displaced, seeking refuge in the bush. Location coordinates are approximate.
14 September. Ambazonian separatists and military forces reportedly clashed in Bafut. According to local sources, civilians accounted for the majority of the 'half a dozen' fatalities (coded as 6).

September 2018. Verified video depicting Ambazonian separatists holding the decapitated head of a police officer. The date of the incident and the precise location are unclear, although the location is believe to have occurred in Belo.
Month of September. Residents protest poor energy provision in Dimako, stopping traffic on the RN 10 from Yaounde to Bertoua. [size=crowds]
16 September (on or around). A civilian was killed by a stray bullet at a check-point that was intended for unidentified gunmen.
16 September (on or around). Security forces reportedly shot and killed a teacher in Bali. The forces checked the man's phone then proceeded to shoot him.

17 September (on or around). A man was killed by soldiers near the Ndu Tea Estate, an area patrolled by security forces. The soldiers then dropped the body off at the Tatum Council. No further details on why the man was killed.
17 September. Military forces reportedly seized control of an Ambazonian camp in Njikwa. Approximately 30 separatists were killed during the attack and two soldiers were injured.
17 September. Separatists and military forces clashed in Oku. No indication on fatalities.

properties.NOTES: 17 September. The military killed two members of Boko Haram in Zelevet.
17 September. Military forces attack Acha Tugui village, killing two men and injuring one other.

18 September. The Mayor of Kumba's son and driver were kidnapped by unidentified armed men while driving on the Matoh road. They were released after several hours.
19 September. Military forces reportedly killed two men in the village of Babanki

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 19 September. Boko Haram attacked the village of Goreya, killing four IDPs and injuring one other person. The coordinates are approximate, based on location being 18km from Blangoua in Blangoua commune.

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 20 September. A BIR vehicle hit an IED near Amchide. Six soldiers were injured.

20 September (on or around). Military forces entered the neighborhood of Boh Kamadoh in Bali looking for separatists and beat five women in an effort to get information. They also reportedly killed a disabled man and 'molested' another man.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 20 September. Boko Haram looted the Goudjimdele health centre.
21 September. Military forces and separatists have reportedly clashed in Bafut. No indication of fatalities.
21 September. Military forces raided a separatist hideout and killed an Ambazonian leader known as "Commando" in Kumba.

22 September. The military reportedly mistook a group of civilian men loading a truck for separatists and opened fire on them. Seven fatalities were reported. Coordinates for this location are approximate, based on location a few kilometres from Kitiwum

22 September. An unidentified group destroyed a bridge along the Ndop-Bamali road to prevent military reinforcements from entering the area. A temporary bridge has been constructed but it cannot support large vehicles.

properties.ASSOC_ACTO: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
properties.NOTES: 23 September. A member of the MRC assaulted an SDF supporter before a political rally, tearing his t-shirt apart.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On September 24, between Djabire town in Dargala district (Diamare, Extreme Nord), Boko Haram killed six people.
24 September. Soldiers killed two men in Ndop and burned down two houses. Residents fled to the bush.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 24 September. Boko Haram entered Yegoua and looted a local shop.
24 September. Ambazonian separatists attacked a military base in Essu. Locals reported 10 fatalities, including seven soldiers.
24 September. Security forces reportedly killed two young men who tried to flee when they saw the soldiers approaching in Kumba.
25 September. Armed men entered the village of Wangara and killed two civilians. The group also stole goats which were later retrieved by BIR.
19 September - 3 October. Military forces took over the Balikumbat health centre and turned it into military barracks.

properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
properties.NOTES: 26 September. Armed men stormed a prison in Wum, freeing at least 80 inmates.
27 September (on or around). Military forces and separatists exchanged fire in Bamenda. No indication of fatalities.
27 September. Military forces stormed the house of a man in Bachuo Ntai and killed the man and his two sons. Another man was also killed by the soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 27 September. Boko Haram attacked seven civilians in Tala Malabrahim, four were beheaded, two escaped and an elderly man was spared.
28 September. The military launched an attack on a separatist camp in Ndop. Six separatists were reportedly killed.
28 September. Military forces and separatists exchanged gun fire for hours in Bali-Nyonga. At least one civilian death confirmed at time of reporting.

properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
properties.NOTES: 29 September. Separatists attempted to storm the Bamenda Central Prison but their attack as repelled. Additional security precautions have been taken at the prison.
29 September. Ambazonian separatists attacked the military barracks and neighboring police station in Mbengwi.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 29 September. Boko Haram attacked Ngouma, killing three men and abducting one woman.

29 September. Suspected Ambazonian Separatists burned down the home of the Divisional Coordinator of the ruling CPDM party, Benjamin Mutanga Itoe. Itoe had recently been campaigning for President Biya in the anglophone region, despite Ambazonian rejectio

29 September. Residents in Bali-Nyonga heard the sound of a car driving through the area followed by gun shots. The next day they discovered the bodies of two male youths. The deceased were not local residents and remain unidentified.
Assumed on September 29, in Maroua town (Diamare, Extreme Nord), local residents staged a demonstration and raised a banner during candidate Paul Biya's visit to the area.

properties.ACTOR2: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 30 September. Boko Haram attacked Tolkomari but were repelled by the military. Two civilians were killed during the attack.
01 October. Military forces killed seven separatists in Wum.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 01 October. Two members of the Kerawa vigilante group were killed by Boko Haram in the bush near Kerawa.
01 October. Military forces and separatists clashed in Kumbo. Several fatalities reported (unknown number coded as 10).
01 October. Military forces and separatists clashed in Bambili after separatist tried to raise the Ambazonian flag in the town.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 02 October. Two female suicide bombers suspected to be linked to Boko Haram set off explosives in the Kolofata market. Seven killed (including the two bombers).
03 October. The military defused an explosive device, found on the Ardori- Homeka road.
04 October. A priest was killed by soldiers in Bamessing. He had stayed at the church after mass and was later shot and tortured by soldiers.
05 October. Soldiers burned down homes in Bafia after clashes with separatists.
05 October. Military forces and separatists clashed around Bafia. Following the battle, soldiers burned down homes in the town (coded as a separate event).
05 October. Military forces raided a separatist site in Otu, killing seven.
06 October. An unidentified group set fire to the High Court in Kumba.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 06 October. Boko Haram attacked Double, killing two civilians.
07 October. The military intervened as separatists attempted to set fire to the polling station in Bafut.
07 October. Ambazonian Separatists attacked a polling station in Alou but were repelled by military forces.
07 October. Military forces killed at least two separatists (some sources indicate three) in Bamenda, who shot at a passerby while they were on a motorcycle.
07 October (on or before). Soldiers killed a civilian in Ekona, who they mistook for an Ambazonian Separatists.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 08 October. Boko Haram attacked the village of Goni Kourmi in Kolofata. One person was injured during the attack. According to reports, Boko Haram crossed into Nigeria after leaving the village.
09 October (on or around). Military forces killed four people in Dumbo. According to the military they were separatists, while other sources reported that they were civilians.
09 October (on or around). Military forces burned homes in Dumbo, forcing the local residents to seek refuge in the bush.
10 October. Two civilians were killed in Kumba. It is believed that they were targeted by separatists due to voting in the election, which the Ambazonian Separatists had warned against.
10 October. Bareta (a pro-Anglophone source) reported that 15 civilians were killed by military forces in Ekona. This could not be verified.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 10 October. An armed group, believed to be Boko Haram, killed two villagers in Vizik (no coordinates available).
10 October. The Mayor of Kumbo was kidnapped in Sabga by an unidentified armed group. The mayor was released the following day, without any injuries.
11 October. The military killed seven separatists during raids in Eshobi.
11 October. Military forces killed four separatists in Misaje.
12 October. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clashed in Weh. One civilian was killed in the cross-fire. The coordinates are approximate, based on location 4km from Wum.
13 October (on or around). Military forces opened fire in Bamenda, killing one person and injuring four children.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 13 October. Boko Haram looted Bouaram, a village in Darak (no coordinates available).
14 October (on or around). Military forces clashed with Ambazonian Separatists in Mamfe.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 14 October. Boko Haram stole sheep near Mozogo before crossing the border back to Nigeria.
15 October (on or around). A 16 year old was taken from his home in Bali-Nyonga by soldiers. The soldiers then shot and killed him.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 15 October. Military forces clashed with Boko Haram in Amchide. Several were injured and a few members of Boko Haram were arrested.
17 October. Ambazonian Separatists kidnapped the sister of SDF president and presidential candidate John Fru Ndi in retaliation for Ndi's participation in the election.
17 October (on or before). Soldiers killed a 13 year old boy who was seeking refuge in the bush near Muyuka.

17 October. Chairman of the Social Democratic Front, John Fru Ndi, home in Baba was set on fire. The attack comes two days after soldiers shot Ndi's driver. According to the SDF flagbearer, the attack was perpetrated by separatist in retaliation for Ndi'
18 October (on or before). Military forces killed 17 separatists during an operation in Ndop.
19 October. An armed group abducted six students from a high school in Bamenda. Local sources report that one of the hostages escaped, but this has not been confirmed.
20 October (on or before). Three bodies were discovered in Bamenda. Some believe they may have been killed elsewhere before being dumped in Bamenda.
20 October. The principal of GBHS in Jakiri was kidnapped by suspected separatists. According to locals, he has been targeted in the past for not 'supporting the struggle.'
21 October. Military forces launched an attack on an Ambazonian Separatists camp in Oku. Eight separatists were killed and four soldiers were injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 21 October. Boko Haram abducted eight women and a baby in Vourkaza.
21 October. Military forces and gendarmerie attack civilians in Rom and Nsah areas, killing 4 civilians and burning buildings.
22 October. Military forces clashed with Ambazonian Separatists in Bambui.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 23 October. Military forces clashed with Ambazonian Separatists in Bombe Bakundu. Six suspected separatist were killed as well as a man previously registered as a refugee (unlear if civilian or fighting alongside the separatists). Coordinates are approxi

23 October. The military launched several operations against Ambazonian Separatists across four Anglophone districts (Bui, Mezam, Dongo Mantung and Ngo Ketunjia). Local sources indicate 30 fatalities, which have been disaggregated across the four distric

23 October. Soldiers pulled two civilians out of a vehicle in Njaynyuy (no coordinates available) and shot them.

23 October. Military forces and separatists clashed in Ngarum. Five civilians, one separatist and two soldiers were killed between two days of fighting (disaggregated as four fatalities per day). Other sources have indicated as many as 15 fatalities.
24 October. Military forces traveling from Wum to Essu clashed with Ambazonian Separatists along the route.
24 October. Soldiers clashed with Separatists in Bambili. Locals could not move around the city due to the on-going fighting.
24 October. Soldiers killed a passenger in Njaynyuy (no coordinates available).

24 October. Clashes between the military and separatists in Ngarum continued for the second day. Five civilians, one separatist and two soldiers were killed between two days of fighting (disaggregated as four fatalities per day). Other sources have indic
25 October. Soldiers killed two civilians in Bamali then left their bodies at 3 Corners.
25 October. The corpse of a person with a mental disability was discovered between Weh and Essu. Date of killing is unclear.
25 October. Ambazonian Separatists and military forces continued to clash in Bambui.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 25 October. Boko Haram killed two people in Amchide.
25 October. Military forces clashed with Separatists in Babessi.
25 October. Military forces clashed with Ambazonian Separatists in Bamali.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 25 October. During the night, Boko Haram raided Igawa and killed two people.

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 25 October. Boko Haram entered Cheripouri in Kolofata to loot the village and clashed with BIR soldiers. One killed.
25 October. A professor was killed by unknown perpetrators in Bambui who followed him. Clashes between separatists and the military occurred on the same day in the town.
25 October. Military forces arrived in Essu and killed four civilians, including a blind person. They also burned down several houses.
26 October. Military forces continued to clash with Ambazonian Separatists in Babessi.
26 October (on or around). Military forces killed three separatists in Essu and freed the local monarch, whom had been kidnapped.
27 October. Anti-Biya protests were held in Bafouddam but quickly disperse by police.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 27 October. Boko Haram abducted a woman in Kassibe.
28 October. Military forces burned down homes in Nyassosso village after clashes with Separatists. People fled to the bush.
28 October. Military forces and Separatists clashed in Nyassosso. Five civilians were killed in the cross fire. After the clash, the military burned homes in the area (coded as a separate event).

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: Looting: On 28 October, Boko Haram looted food supplies and livestock from Hamande (in Darak).
29 October. A civilian was killed behind his house in Njenka. Soldiers are believed to be responsible for the attack
29 October. Following the killing of a civilian by soldiers, Ambazonian Separatists and military forces clashed around Njenka.
29 October. Military forces and Separatists clashed in Bambili.
30 October. Gendarme forces force civilians to flee and destroy property in Guzang, Batibo.

30 October. The City Community radio station in Kumbo was burned down. Ambazonian Separatists are believed to be responsible for the attack as they have previously attempted attacks on the station master, whom they accuse of collaborating with the milita

30 October. Ambazonian Separatists attacked soldiers in Bambili, sparking a clash between the groups. A US missionary was killed in the cross fire and four separatists were also killed. The Cameroonian government has blamed Separatist for the missionary'

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 31 October. Ambazonian forces attacked a military site in Balikumbat. BIR forces repelled the attack and killed three separatists.

31 October. Soldiers attacked Mbeme and Moshie in Bayang in the early morning. Seven civilians were killed during the attacks, five occurred in Moshie. It is unclear where the two remaining fatalities occurred so they were coded at Mbeme. Property was al

properties.NOTES: 31 October. Two members of Boko Haram were killed by the Joint Task Force in Boudoua (no coordinates available).
31 October. Military forces killed one civilian, injured others, and set fire to homes in Balikumbat, according to residents. The military denied this.
31 October. Armed men abducted the principal of GTHS Jakiri school.

31 October. Soldiers attacked Mbeme and Moshie in Bayang in the early morning. Seven civilians were killed during the attacks, five occurred in Moshie. It is unclear where the two remaining fatalities occurred so they were coded at Mbeme. Property was al

properties.NOTES: 01 November. Boko Haram killed four people in Igawa.

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 01 November. A BIR vehicle hit an IED along the Vouzi-Vreket road. Two soldiers were injured.
01 November. An Ambazonian Separatist accidentally fired a weapon, killing a 14 year old girl in the Bafmeng (no coordinates available) market, Fungom subdivision in Menchum.
01 November. There was on-going gun fire heard near the Balikumbat health centre, which the military uses as a base.
01 November. A vigilante group lynched four Ambazonian Separatists after one accidentally shot a young girl in the Bafmeng (no coordinates available) market, Fungom subdivision in Menchum.
01 November. Military forces clashed with Ambazonian Separatists in Bamessing.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 02 November. Boko Haram decapitated a man in his field in Baljoel.

properties.ASSOC_ACTO: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
properties.NOTES: 04 November. Kamto supporters protested in Bafoussam over the presidential election results. Police dispersed the protest. At least 19 arrests were made, while the MRC has said 38 were detained.

05 November. Seventy-nine students and three school administrators were kidnapped from the Presbyterian Secondary School in Bamenda. Ambazonian separatists were believed to be responsible for the abduction but have released statements denying any involve
05 November. Ambazonian Separatists killed two people in Batibo. The victims were accused of colluding with the military.
29 October - 12 November. At some point during this time period, a soldier was killed by kidnappers in Belel.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 06 November. Boko Haram killed a member of a vigilante committee group in Tchika during the night and abducted the man's seven children.
07 November. The IS-aligned Boko Haram faction released a video claiming to have killed a man whom they accused of spying for the JTF in Chek (no coordinates available).

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: On November 11, in Belel town in Belel district (Vina, Adamoua), unidentified actors engaged in a clash with an element of Rapid Intervention Battalion. One Rapid Intervention Battalion member was killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 11 November. Military forces killed one member of Boko Haram and captured another in Mozogo.
On November 12, in Mbot town (Donga-Mantung, Nord-Ouest), the Cameroon military battled Ambazonia separatists, leaving 26 people dead.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 12 November. A BIR soldier was killed during a clash with an armed group of kidnappers in Belel.
On November 13, in Ndu town (Donga-Mantung, Nord-Ouest), the Cameroon military battled Ambazonia separatists, leaving 15 separatists dead.

On November 13, in Bafut town (Mezam, Nord-Ouest) , students and staff abducted more than a week ago by armed Ambazonia separatists from a school in Cameroon's restive North West region have been freed.
On November 14, in Ndu town (Donga-Mantung, Nord-Ouest), the mayor of Nwa was killed by Ambazonia separatists.
On November 14, near Nkambe town (Donga-Mantung, Nord-Ouest), the Cameroon military continued to battle Ambazonia separatists, leaving 15 separatists dead.
Month of November. Military forces destroy and steal medical property in Kumbo of Jakiri.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On November 16, in Gogo village (Mayo-Sava, Extreme Nord), Boko Haram militants attacked the village, injured five people, burned huts, and stole three motorcycles.

properties.ACTOR1: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: 17 November. Boko Haram attacked Gogolomiyode. Five people were injured during the attack. The perpetrators stole motorcycles and burned homes in the village.
19 November (on or around). Ambazonian separatists set fire to the grandstand at the center of Bali Nyonga.

19 November. Ambazonian Separatists opened fire on soldiers in Bali Nyonga. The two groups exchanged fire for an hour, after which the separatists fled down the main street. The military then set all the buildings along the road on fire. Local sources in
19 November. Military forces attack civilians in Ngwa in the Ouest province, killing 3.

On November 20, near Kumba town (Ndian, Sud-Ouest), Cameroon military forces clashed with armed Ambazonian separatists who abducted students and teachers from Lords Bilingual School, leaving two separatists dead.
On November 20, in Kumba town (Ndian, Sud-Ouest), armed Ambazonian separatists abducted students and teachers from Lords Bilingual School.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: November 19-21. Cameroon military BIR and gendarmerie forces burn around 60 residential buildings and city hall in Abu of Menchum and 3 homes in Muteff.

On November 21, near Kumba town (Ndian, Sud-Ouest), Cameroon military forces clashed for a second day with armed Ambazonian separatists who abducted students and teachers from Lords Bilingual School, leaving two separatists dead and freeing nine of the c
On November 21, in Belo town (Boyo, Nord-Ouest), Ambazonian separatists killed the Vice Principal of the Government Bilingual High School.
On November 21, in Kembong town (Manyu, Sud-Ouest), a Kenyan priest at a church was killed by government soldiers who were firing at random from their vehicle.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
properties.NOTES: 21 November. Ambazonian Separatists ambushed BIR forces in Lewoh (Alou, Leblialem).

On November 22, in Bali town (Mezam, Nord-Ouest), Cameroon's military engaged in battles with Ambazonian separatists, killing 21 separatists, destroying three villages, seizing a huge consignment of guns, ammunition, machetes, motorcycles and drugs.

On November 22, in Fundong town (Boyo, Nord-Ouest), Cameroon's military engaged in battles with Ambazonian separatists, killing 22 separatists, destroying three villages, seizing a huge consignment of guns, ammunition, machetes, motorcycles and drugs.

Over the weekend of November 24-25, Ambazonian separatists clashed with the Cameroon military in Babungo (Ngo-Ketunjia, Nord-Ouest) and Batibo (Momo, Nord-Ouest) towns, leaving 65 civilians dead. Fatalities spread over four events.

Over November 24-25, Ambazonian separatists clashed with the Cameroon military in Babungo town (Ngo-Ketunjia, Nord-Ouest) and Batibo town (Momo, Nord-Ouest), leaving 65 civilians dead. Fatalities spread over four events.

Over November 24-25, Ambazonian separatists clashed with the Cameroon military in Babungo town (Ngo-Ketunjia, Nord-Ouest) and Batibo town (Momo, Nord-Ouest), leaving 65 civilians dead. Fatalities spread over four events.

Over November 24-25, Ambazonian separatists clashed with the Cameroon military in Babungo town (Ngo-Ketunjia, Nord-Ouest) and Batibo town (Momo, Nord-Ouest), leaving 65 civilians dead. Fatalities spread over four events.
26 November. Ambazonian forces stormed Ako, burning the police station and customs office and killing two civilians. Security forces responded by opening fire, killing seven separatists.

Around November 27, in Fundong town (Boyo, Nord-Ouest), women gathered in demonstration to call for peace and to mourn those departed as a result of the crisis in the North West and South West regions of the country.
27 November. Armed men abducted a barrister in Bamenda.
27 November. Ambazonian Separatists clashed with military forces in Ndop.

properties.ACTOR2: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
properties.NOTES: On November 28, in Amchide city (Mayosava, Extreme-Nord), police shot and killed a second Boko Haram woman who was equipped with a suicide vest some time after a female Boko Haram militant detonated a suicide vest and wounded 29 people in a market place

On November 29, Cameroon has reactivated village militias on its northern border with Nigeria after twin suicide bombings November 28 wounded 29 people. A group of 200 militia men were mobilized from 20 villages to defend against further Boko Haram attac
On December 1, in Kumbo town (Bui, Nord-Ouest), Ambazonian Separatists abducted Sehm Mbinglo, the Fon (leader) of the Nso people. He was later released.
01 December. During the weekend, Separatists and military forces clashed in Mankon. Three people were killed.
02 December. Clashes between military forces and Ambazonian Separatists occurred around Ekona.
02 December. Ambazonian fighters blocked the Buea-Kumba road in Ekona, following clashes with the military.

December 3 - 6. Soldiers attack Kumbo of Jakiri and surrounding areas over several days burning over 55 homes and killing civilians. Unknown fatalities coded as 3 (spread across four days of violence)
04 December. Ambazonian Separatists set fire to two trucks carrying tea in Ngo-Ketunjia.

December 3 - 6. Soldiers attack Kumbo of Jakiri and surrounding areas over several days burning over 55 homes and killing civilians. Unknown fatalities coded as 3 (spread across four days of violence)
December 5. Roman Catholic priest detained with guns and rudimentary weapons by a Ambazonian separatist group, called the "Amba boys" on the road in Batibo. The priest was released on the same day.

December 3 - 6. Soldiers attack Kumbo of Jakiri and surrounding areas over several days burning over 55 homes and killing civilians. Unknown fatalities coded as 3 (spread across four days of violence)
